title: Home-Based Medicine Care Coordinator/Nurse Practitioner
description: HealthPartners is looking for a Certified Adult/Geriatric or Family Nurse Practitioner to join our Home-Based Medicine Team.

raw.title: Home-Based Medicine Care Coordinator/Nurse Practitioner
raw.excerpt: HealthPartners is looking for a Certified Adult/Geriatric or Family Nurse Practitioner to join our Home-Based Medicine Team.
raw.description:
HealthPartners is looking for a Certified Adult/Geriatric or Family Nurse Practitioner to join our Home-Based Medicine Team. Being a part of our team means you will have an impact on the care that our patients receive every day.

As a Home-Based Medicine Nurse Practitioner/Care Coordinator, you will be part of the largest multi-specialty care system in the Twin Cities. This position will provide both telehealth and fieldwork with seeing patients in their homes. Local travel required.

This individual will provide the primary health care for patients at home.

  • Provide care coordination to achieve patient centered, high quality and cost-effective care across the continuum

  • Provide nursing leadership in defining and achieving program goals in a changing healthcare environment

  • Utilizes principals of quality of life, maintenance of optimal function and the patient’s advanced directives in developing plan of care

  • Supportive, patient-centered practice

  • MN RN and APRN licensure required along with prescriptive authority

  • Home Based Medicine experience (NP or RN) preferred

  • Must be able to provide own transportation for local travel.

You will be joining a team that is supportive and respectful of one another and deeply committed to the mission of HealthPartners. Here, you’ll become a partner for good, helping to improve the health and well-being of our patients, members and community. Our commitment to excellence, compassion, partnership and integrity is behind everything we do. It’s the type of work that makes a difference, the kind of work you can be proud of. We hope you’ll join us.

WORK SCHEDULE:

8am – 5:00 pm

BENEFITS:

HealthPartners benefit offerings (for 0.5 FTE or greater) include medical insurance, dental insurance, 401k with company contribution and match, 457(b) with company contribution, life insurance, AD&D insurance, disability insurance, malpractice insurance for work done on behalf of HealthPartners as well as a CME reimbursement account. Our clinician well-being program provides a wealth of information, tools, and resources tailored to meet the unique needs of our health care professionals, including physicians, advanced practice clinicians (APCs) and dentists. HealthPartners is a qualified non-profit employer under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness program.

TO APPLY:

For additional information, please contact Judy Brown, Sr. Physician and APC Recruiter, judith.k.brown@HealthPartners.com. For immediate consideration, please apply online.

title: Quality Assurance Associate
description: Position SummaryThe Quality Assurance Associate ensures adherence to industry regulations and company quality standards by reviewing insurance policies, documentation, and operational processes.

raw.title: Quality Assurance Associate
raw.excerpt: Position SummaryThe Quality Assurance Associate ensures adherence to industry regulations and company quality standards by reviewing insurance policies, documentation, and operational processes.
raw.description:
Position Summary

The Quality Assurance Associate ensures adherence to industry regulations and company quality standards by reviewing insurance policies, documentation, and operational processes. The role conducts audits and evaluates the performance of Underwriters and Servicing Representatives, supports continuous improvement, and collaborates with internal teams to resolve quality concerns.

What will your job entail?

Responsibilities

  • Perform monthly quality assessments of office account files and deliver findings to support process and underwriting alignment.
  • Review policy and servicing files to verify rating accuracy, appropriate coverage and forms usage, and adherence to underwriting standards.
  • Analyze root causes for quality concerns and coordinate corrective actions.
  • Monitor quality results over time to identify trends, emerging risk areas, and systemic breakdowns; collaborate with stakeholders to design and implement scalable remediation strategies that strengthen underwriting consistency, operational accuracy, and regulatory compliance.
  • Maintain accurate audit records and quality documentation.
  • Prepare and present quality results and recommendations reports
  • Stay current with regulatory and underwriting compliance requirements.
  • Utilize QA tools to enhance assessment efficiency.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently, take initiative, and manage workload with minimal supervision.

Experience & Education

  • 2+ years of experience in P&C underwriting such as risk evaluation, rating, and form selection.
  • Experience in insurance QA, underwriting support, or insurance operations is a plus.
  • Bachelor’s degree required; Business Administration, Quality Management, or Business Operations preferred. Any other related discipline or commensurate work experience considered.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel a plus, including use of formulas, filters, and data validation.

In addition to paid time off for company holidays, vacation, sick and personal days, Ryan offers paid parental leave, mental health services and more.

The wage range for this role considers many factors, such as training, transferable skills, work experience, licensure and certification, business needs, and market demands. The pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. Full-time roles are eligible for bonuses and benefits. For additional information on Ryan Specialty Total Rewards, visit our website https://benefits.ryansg.com/.

We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. VEGA Americas, Inc. is a fast-growing organization looking for an Outside Sales Representative for the Greater Lexington, KY market. This is an entry-level position designed for individuals looking to launch a career in industrial sales. The primary purpose of this role is to build customer relationships, drive sales growth, and develop the foundational skills necessary for long-term success in outside sales. The Tier 1 Sales Representative will receive comprehensive training, mentorship, and hands-on experience while promoting VEGA’s innovative sensor solutions within an assigned territory.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. Other duties as assigned by management.

raw.excerpt: At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world.
raw.description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.

Representante de ventas Lilly

El Orquestador del negocio

En Eli Lilly buscamos personas apasionadas que se unan a nuestro propósito de mejorar la vida de las personas en el mundo.

Vivimos en un mundo de constante cambio y evolución y en Lilly, somos conscientes del impacto que esto tiene en nuestro negocio y forma de trabajo, lo cual nos impulsa a tomar lo que tenemos y hacerlo mejor y mejor cada día.

La fuerza de ventas de Lilly necesita más que representes de ventas…orquestadores de ventas, que se adueñen del negocio y tomen los recursos disponibles para maximizarlos de forma estratégica e impactar de forma positiva a nuestros principales clientes con el propósito de mejorar la vida de las personas en el mundo.

Roles y Responsabilidades

  • Entender, implementar y comunicar efectivamente la estrategia comercial mediante la promoción de nuestros productos.
  • Aplicar los recursos multicanal (digital y presencial) disponibles, de forma adecuada y estratégica en el canal correcto con el cliente correcto.
  • Analizar tu negocio para tomar decisiones que te permitan hacerlo crecer.
  • Visitar a los médicos y farmacias en el tiempo correcto y con la frecuencia correcta.
  • Accionar siempre con los más altos estándares de ética y responsabilidad.

Habilidades y Competencias

  • Incluir: Trabajar en equipo creando un ambiente diverso e inclusivo, comunicándose de forma efectiva con colaboradores y clientes e influenciar de forma positiva con o sin autoridad.
  • Innovar: Pensar y ser curioso en búsqueda de la mejora continua, adaptarse al cambio constante, ser creativo e invertir tiempo en su propio desarrollo.
  • Acelerar: Pensar estratégicamente y analizar para tomar decisiones ágiles, resolver problemas de forma rápida y efectiva, planear y organizarse ante un ambiente diverso y con constantes accionables, sobreponer obstáculos y trabajar con inteligencia emocional.
  • Cumplir: Mostrar disciplina en ejecución con respecto a la visita médica, maximización de recursos multicanal y demostrar coraje e integridad día a día.

Requerimientos:

  • Estar titulado de cualquier licenciatura o ingeniería.
  • Nivel ingles intermedio-alto.
  • Experiencia manejando y contar con licencia de conducir vigente.
  • Manejo de plataformas tecnológicas relacionadas con análisis de información y comunicación virtual.

Lo que ofrecemos:

  • Salario competitivo y un amplio portafolio de beneficios extralegales.
  • Un ambiente de trabajo construido sobre el trabajo en equipo, flexibilidad y respeto.
  • Crecimiento profesional, y programas de desarrollo para ejecutar un plan de carrera dentro de la compañía.
  • Programas de bienestar laboral y medicina integral para tí y tu familia.
  • Flexibilidad laboral.

Zona : Base en CDMX (Lindavista)

Viaje: Chetumal (1 semana al mes)

title: Software Developer
description: As a Software Developer at Princeton10, you will contribute to building and maintaining high-quality software solutions that support both internal teams and client-facing work.

raw.title: Software Developer
raw.excerpt: As a Software Developer at Princeton10, you will contribute to building and maintaining high-quality software solutions that support both internal teams and client-facing work.
raw.description:
As a Software Developer at Princeton10, you will contribute to building and maintaining high-quality software solutions that support both internal teams and client-facing work. This role is execution-focused and requires strong attention to detail, discipline in following specifications, and ownership of correctness. You will work closely with senior developers and cross-functional partners to implement features and fixes accurately, consistently, and in alignment with defined requirements, particularly within regulated environments such as healthcare and pharma.

Responsibilities

  • Software Development & Delivery
  • Write, test, and maintain clean, well-structured code across front-end and or back-end systems, implementing defined specifications with a high degree of accuracy.
  • Develop features, enhancements, and bug fixes based on documented requirements, technical designs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Validate work thoroughly before requesting review, including checking alignment to specs, considering edge cases, and performing appropriate testing.
  • Debug and resolve routine issues related to functionality, performance, reliability, or regressions introduced by code changes.
  • Follow established coding standards, security practices, and development workflows, with particular attention to compliance and documentation expectations in regulated environments.
    • Collaboration & Learning
  • Collaborate with designers, project managers, and senior developers to understand requirements, clarify ambiguities, and execute solutions effectively.
  • Communicate status, risks, and questions clearly and proactively, particularly when specifications are unclear or constraints may affect delivery.
  • Participate in code reviews by receiving feedback thoughtfully and applying it consistently, and by offering clear, constructive input when appropriate.
  • Present technical work and implementation decisions clearly to internal stakeholders when needed, even though the role is primarily heads-down and execution-focused.
    • Quality, Craft & Reliability
  • Demonstrate strong ownership of code quality and correctness from initial implementation through final delivery.
  • Use existing frameworks, components, patterns, and checklists to ensure consistency and maintainability across projects.
  • Maintain clear and accurate documentation where required to support long-term system reliability and team understanding.
  • Ensure assigned work is complete, stable, and ready for review before presenting it to senior developers or the broader team.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
  • 2–4 years of professional software development experience (or equivalent hands-on experience).
  • Working proficiency in at least one modern programming language or framework (e.g., JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, .NET, or similar).
  • Basic understanding of APIs, data structures, and web or application architecture.
  • Familiarity with cloud environments or deployment workflows (AWS, Azure, GCP, or similar) is a plus.
  • Strong willingness to learn, collaborate, and grow within a team-oriented environment.
  • Clear communication skills and the ability to explain technical work to both technical and non-technical teammates.
Interested in working with us? Apply online today.
Not an agency*The layer-laden teams. The prehistoric processes. The impersonal, ego-driven dog-and-pony shows. Take what you think you know about agencies and burn it. P10 was born of the idea that if something isn’t working—or could work better—change it. And that’s exactly what we did. We know that what we’re not makes us who we are. And we’re not just another agency. We are people driven by a palpable passion and purpose, felt by our clients from the very first conversation.
P10 brings together a team of diverse, remote-only seasoned professionals to deliver exceptional value for our clients. Dare to do something different - join us.

raw.description:
Veeam, the #1 global market leader in data resilience, believes businesses should control all their data whenever and wherever they need it. Veeam provides data resilience through data backup, data recovery, data portability, data security, and data intelligence. Based in Seattle, Veeam protects over 550,000 customers worldwide who trust Veeam to keep their businesses running. Join us as we move forward together, growing, learning, and making a real impact for some of the world’s biggest brands. The future of data resilience is here - go fearlessly forward with us.

What You'll Do

  • Develop and close business with within the large private sector
  • Leverage partners to close sales with their end customers
  • Cold calls to develop sales activities with a large number of new mid-market and high-segment accounts
  • Up-sell and cross-sell to the existing private customer base
  • Forecasts and account/opportunity details in Salesforce
  • Propose, coordinate and participate to marketing activities in the territory

What You'll Bring:

  • At least 5 years of experience in sales
  • Experience with vendors associated to Virtualization and Cloud AI technology is a plus 
  • Have an experience of selling through channel and direct 
  • Track record of accomplishment selling in the private market to the IT infrastructure specialists
  • Proven ability to develop new sales 
  • Be a self-starter with the ability to learn quickly
  • Be a high-energy salesperson
  • Be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment where roles and responsibilities change quickly
  • Be comfortable travelling for at least 70% of the time.
  • Current full driving license
  • Business proficient language skills in Polish & English

What You'll Get:

Veeam offers benefits that support your whole self:

  • 26 paid vacation days, plus 4 extra global VeeaMe Days for self-care and 24 paid volunteer hours annually through Veeam Cares
  • Statutory public health insurance with employer and employee contributions
  • Statutory pension scheme with employer and employee contributions
  • Statutory accident insurance fully funded by Veeam
  • Supplemental pension plan with employer match and salary sacrifice option
  • Supplemental accident insurance with 24/7 worldwide coverage
  • Opportunities to learn and grow through on-demand libraries (LinkedIn Learning, O’Reilly), mentoring, workshops and learning events like our annual Global Day of Learning

Please note: If an applicant is permanently located outside of Poland, Veeam reserves the right to decline the application for this position.

Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.

By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that the information provided in your job application and any supporting documents is complete and accurate to the best of your knowledge. Effective Date: variable, minimum 3 months to 6 months commitment preferred
Location Note: Hybrid work environment with office in Wakefield, MA. Must be available for In-office two to four days per month and at maximum three multi day events spring/summer/fall.
The Purpose of Your Role:
We are looking for rising students who would like to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced software development environment. Our interns aren’t getting coffee or taking notes; they become a true part of the team and of the organization as a whole. You will learn about the company and its culture and learn how to build and maintain software. Additionally, you will gain valuable experience working in a professional business environment, being integrated in the team, allowing you to build skills, get feedback on your performance, and gain advice and insights for your future career.
What you'll bring to Sentinel:
We are looking for someone who has a growth mindset and likes to take on challenges. You should feel comfortable jumping into projects and tasks, and like helping to develop solutions.
What you’ll be responsible for:
  • Migrate automated workflows to Apache Airflow (Python)
  • Implement new features for existing applications (TypeScript)

Preferred qualifications:

  • Strong listening and communication skills
  • Knowledge with Python (Airflow desirable)
  • Good to know: TypeScript, React, agile development
  • Pay rate for this position is $25/hour

What you’ll be part of:
Joining our company means becoming part of something special. We're driven by a mission to excel in our industry and within our team, supported by people who truly care about our organization.

Sentinel was recently recognized by The Boston Globe as a Top Place to Work in 2020, 2023 and 2025. In 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, Sentinel earned a Top Workplace USA Award from Energage.

At Sentinel, we welcome people from diverse experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives – and we wouldn’t have it any other way. So even if you don’t meet every single requirement, please consider applying if you like what you see. Our priority is to find talented individuals who enrich our team culture, contribute with enthusiasm, and are passionate about what they do.

Sentinel is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes everyone to our team. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Some of our Benefits:
  • PTO (vacation, sick, personal time bank)
  • FTO (Flexible time off for vacation, sick, and personal time) after 2 years of service
  • 12 Paid Holidays (10 stated and 2 floating holidays)
  • 2 Community Volunteer Days
  • 5 Summer Half Days
  • Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Life Insurance
  • LTD & STD
  • Retirement Plan with 4% Employer Match
  • Parental Leave
See What We Stand For:https://www.sentinelgroup.com/About-Us/Join-Our-Team

Who we are:
Sentinel Group proudly serves nearly 5,000 clients throughout the U.S. For 35+ years, we’ve remained devoted to positively impacting the lives of our people, our clients and our communities. With a 9-year average associate tenure among our 265 professionals, our team’s commitment to excellent service has positioned Sentinel as the only provider who makes benefits EASY: easy for your people; easy for your business; and easy for you.

Our ultimate goal is to help companies and their employees prepare for their future health, wealth and retirement needs. Whether it’s through retirement plans, group health insurance, reimbursement accounts or financial planning, we engineer simple solutions and continuously strive to make them better. Our in-house experts – and their commitment to excellence – define who we are.

title: Project Manager -Product (Retail)
description: OverviewThe Project Manager is a role within the Retail business unit who will work cross-function to help manage projects within this business unit.

raw.title: Project Manager -Product (Retail)
raw.excerpt: OverviewThe Project Manager is a role within the Retail business unit who will work cross-function to help manage projects within this business unit.
raw.description:
Overview

The Project Manager is a role within the Retail business unit who will work cross-function to help manage projects within this business unit. The role is responsible for managing the project from initiation to completion, plus defining ingestion, prioritization and reporting processes. In this role you will partner with a cross functional team, including Marketing, Go-to-Market Effectiveness, Product, R&D, Operations, and other players to plan, organize and execute project plans.

The Project Manager will track all milestones and operational readiness, as well as post launch performance tracking. S/he will be the point of contact for the day-to-day activities facilitating weekly status meetings with internal teams and bi-weekly/monthly executive readouts. This role will routinely create project plans, status decks and executive updates.

Responsibilities

  • Create project ingestion process – what projects get picked, how are they picked and how are projects prioritized
  • Track and ensure projects are hitting key milestones and making progress towards completion
  • Create a reporting system that provides transparency to multiple parties to ensure coordination across the business unit
  • Ensure all internal teams needed to support the projects are identified, needs and dependencies are documented, and the project is tracked to completion, including formal post-completion monitoring.
  • Facilitate weekly/bi-weekly, monthly status meetings, meeting minutes, status reports, and project plans.
  • Identify any potential risks and mitigate/escalate as needed.
  • Effectively communicate in cross-departmental or cross-functional situations. Able to conduct peer training within the department.
  • See emerging patterns and opportunities, adapting quickly and easily to new information, changing conditions, or unexpected events.
  • Facilitate and communicate change across the team or organization to drive adoption.
  • Set clear priorities, take action, stay focused, and overcome barriers to deliver expected results.
  • Evaluate critical information needed to understand problems, determine probable causes, and develop workable solutions. Accurately assess the costs, benefits, and risks associated with alternative courses of action and make high quality and timely decisions.
  • Ability to manage development of the project plan and manage issues and risks by facilitating mitigation and contingency planning with key stakeholders.
  • Apply project management knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to execute projects effectively and efficiently in alignment with organizational competencies and strategic business goals. May manage vendors as part of project team.
  • Behave in a way that consistently demonstrates commitment to Cotiviti values of Integrity, Passionate Client Service, Teamwork, Accountability, Performance Excellence, and Continuous Improvement.
  • Demonstrate understanding of Cotiviti policies, procedures, and external regulatory requirements, and perform duties in accordance with such regulatory requirements. Assure confidentiality and security of all data.
  • Demonstrate the skills, knowledge, and ability to ensure that our environment is a safe one, complying with industry standards.
  • Effectively utilize and convey concepts within the team's specialty area; some exposure to "the big picture" horizontally and vertically; demonstrate knowledge of managed care and program integrity role.
  • Can determine appropriate channels, cadence, and audiences for communications. Able to adapt written and verbal communications to various audiences.
  • Able to define and document business processes and create process flows or playbooks with Microsoft Office, Visio, or other project management tools.
  • Complete all responsibilities as outlined in the annual performance review and/or goal setting.
  • Complete all special projects and other duties as assigned.
  • Must be able to perform duties with or without reasonable accommodation.

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed and is not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and skills required. This job description does not constitute an employment agreement and is subject to change as the needs of Cotiviti and requirements of the job change.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience required.
  • 5+ years of project management experience required.
  • Experience in product development or project management in Source-2-Pay or R&D/Technology/AI is preferred but not required.
  • Yellow belt Six Sigma or other Quality program training.
  • Certification in Project Management (PMP, CAPM, or equivalent).
  • Experience with managing cross-functional projects.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build consensus and develop solid relationships.
  • Must be detail-oriented with strong communication and organizational skills.
  • Problem solver who identifies better ways to meet customer needs.
  • Ability to work well independently and in a team environment.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks, prioritize, and meet deadlines.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
  • Professional with the ability to properly handle confidential information.
  • Ability to work within a matrix organization.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

MENTAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • The intellect and energy to excel in a complex and ever-changing environment, coupled with the poise and ability to act calmly in high-pressure, high-stress situations.
  • Communicating with others to exchange information.
  • Problem-solving and thinking critically.
  • Completing tasks independently.
  • Interpreting data.
  • Making timely decisions in the context of a workflow.
  • Maintaining focus.
  • Assessing the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS

  • Remaining in a stationary position, often standing or sitting for prolonged periods.
  • Repeating motions that may include the wrists, hands, and/or fingers.
  • Must be able to provide high-speed internet access/connectivity and office setup and maintenance.
  • Must be able to provide a dedicated, secure work area.
  • No adverse environmental conditions expected.
Base compensation ranges from $115,000 to $145,000 per year. Specific offers are determined by various factors, such as experience, education, skills, certifications, and other business needs. Cotiviti offers team members a competitive benefits package to address a wide range of personal and family needs, including medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance coverage, 401(k) savings plans, paid family leave, 9 paid holidays per year, and 17-27 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) per year, depending on specific level and length of service with Cotiviti. For information about our benefits package, please refer to our Careers page. Date of posting: 1/21/2026

Applications are assessed on a rolling basis. We anticipate that the application window will close on 3/21/2026, but the application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.

Since this job will be based remotely, all interviews will be conducted virtually.

title: Asset Management Professional
description: Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile.

raw.title: Asset Management Professional
raw.excerpt: Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile.
raw.description:
Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.

We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!

Job Description

The Asset Management Professional (AMP) is an embedded consultant who works with a client to help reduce their MRO demand on the plant floor by implementing methodologies and using our broad portfolio of services and capabilities. Your focus will be to help the client increase productivity, reduce costs, and improve reliability. The asset management professional is an important member of our customer support team and interfaces with sales, services management, product groups, and authorized distributors. You will perform the repair / refurbishment identification and execution activities. You will report directly to the assistant storeroom manager and work onsite in Vance, Alabama.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Handle repair management for Allen Bradley, TP Electrical, and Mechanical Components
  • Make component lifecycle mitigation recommendations
  • Develop SOP's associated with the repair process
  • Identify process improvements regarding the MRO/repair process with focus on plant reliability
  • Coordinate and process repair transactions
  • Provide live tracking for all assets repaired or managed
  • Provide daily reporting and data analysis by gathering product data from customer ERP systems and RA tracking software.
  • Develop relationships with the key customer partners to identify the customer's key performance indicators. Create program metric reports using RA software and other tools that meet customer requirements.
  • Make recommendations based on inventory levels, failure trends, repair history trends, pricing considerations and obsolescence management
  • You will be responsible for communication between the customer account and management, RA sales and distributors and RA Product Management to ensure that required information is provided.

The Essentials - You Will Have:

  • Bachelor's degree
  • Legal authorization to work in the U.S. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future for this job opening.

The Preferred - You Might Also Have:

  • 2+ years of relevant experience
  • Prior experience in inventory or a storeroom
  • Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Experience working within an ERP system software environment
  • Experience in an industrial, plant floor environment

What We Offer:

  • Health Insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision
  • 401k
  • Paid Time off
  • Parental and Caregiver Leave
  • Flexible Work Schedule where you will work with your manager to enjoy a work schedule that can be flexible with your personal life.
  • To learn more about our benefits package, please visit at www.raquickfind.com.

This position is part of a job family. Experience will be the determining factor for position level and compensation.

At Rockwell Automation we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

#LifeAtRok

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans.

If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (844) 404-7247.

Rockwell Automation’s hybrid policy aligns that employees are expected to work at a Rockwell location at least Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays unless they have a business obligation out of the office.

title: Clinical Counsellor (French Speaking)
description: About us: Founded in 1982, Workplace Options (WPO) is the world’s largest independent provider of holistic wellbeing solutions.

raw.title: Clinical Counsellor (French Speaking)
raw.excerpt: About us: Founded in 1982, Workplace Options (WPO) is the world’s largest independent provider of holistic wellbeing solutions.
raw.description:
About us:

Founded in 1982, Workplace Options (WPO) is the world’s largest independent provider of holistic wellbeing solutions. Through customized programs and a global network of credentialed providers, we help individuals become healthier, happier, and more productive—both personally and professionally. Trusted by 51% of Fortune 500 companies, we provide high-quality care digitally and in-person to over 75 million people across 116,000 organizations in more than 200 countries and territories. At WPO, you’ll join a team dedicated to improving employee wellbeing worldwide.

Location: Canada - Alberta (Remote)
Languages required: French and English


About the Role:

We are looking for compassionate and skilled EAP Clinical Counsellors to provide support to clients across Canada. This is a fully remote position, offering flexible day shifts or night shifts and the option for full-time (40 hours/week) or part-time (30 hours/week) work. Salary ranges from $62,000 (day) to $68,000 (night), plus competitive benefits.


What We’re Looking For:

  • Master’s degree in mental health (social work, counselling, psychology, or related field).
  • Licensure is not required; we actively support your journey to obtaining it through clinical supervision and dedicated allowances.
  • Fluency in English and French.
  • Minimum of 2 years of direct client contact providing counselling or mental health services.
  • Experience with clinical assessment tools and short-term counselling modalities such as Solution-Focused Therapy, CBT, Mindfulness, Integrative, or Systemic counselling.
  • Training in crisis intervention and supporting high-risk clients is a plus.
  • Ability to work with clients experiencing substance abuse, crisis situations, mental health symptoms, or relationship/family challenges.

What You’ll Do:

As a Clinical Counsellor, you will connect with clients via phone, video, chat, and email, creating a safe and supportive space where they feel heard and understood. These short videos provide a good insight into what it’s like to be a counsellor here at Workplace Options: Being a Counsellor at WPO and Member Experience - The Power of a Good Conversation

If you are a mental health provider that wants to provide emotional support with a warm and empathic approach to people of all ages, cultures, and backgrounds from around the world, this is the role for you.


Responsibilities:
  • Provide single-session telephonic and video counselling, in-the-moment support, and crisis management.
  • Conduct thorough assessments to determine suitability for short-term counselling.
  • Manage high-risk situations, collaborating with clients and referring appropriately.
  • Appropriately refer clients to external resources or within WPO as part of our holistic approach.
  • Develop clear and concise treatment plans and maintain accurate clinical documentation.
  • Participate in ongoing professional development and contribute to a culture of care and excellence.
  • Any additional tasks pertinent to the position, as deemed appropriate by management.

Why Join WPO?

At WPO, wellbeing isn’t just for our clients—it’s for our employees too. Our benefits and programs include:
  • Paid time off.
  • Extended healthcare, dental and vision coverage, AD&D and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, and employer pension contributions.
  • Monthly clinical supervision, supervision stipends, 24/7 support for risk calls.
  • Access to professional development webinars and workshops, training/tuition reimbursement.
  • Gym reimbursement, wellness rewards, and EAP benefits for employees.
  • Mentorship programs and opportunities to engage with our global community.

At Workplace Options, we are committed to and are accountable for building a workplace where individuals feel empowered to bring their whole selves to work, free from judgment or fear of discrimination. We understand that having a diverse organization is only the beginning and it will require nurturing and care to thrive. We will continue to take action to ensure we achieve equitable and measurable outcomes.

We strive to cultivate a space where diverse voices are not only heard but actively sought out and valued for the unique insights they bring. By embracing and promoting authenticity, we aim to build a vibrant and inclusive community that fosters collaboration, innovation, belonging and personal growth.

For further details about WPO please check out our website www.workplaceoptions.com and these short videos give a great overview of what we do Human-Powered Care and The WPO Global Experience

Workplace Options collects and processes personal data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you are a European job applicant, refer to our Privacy Notice for further details (https://www.workplaceoptions.com/privacy-notice-for-recruitment/).

title: Head of Data & AI
description: Job Description:Head of Data & AIABOUT GLADSTONE Gladstone is the leading supplier of leisure management software across the UK and Ireland.

raw.title: Head of Data & AI
raw.excerpt: Job Description:Head of Data & AIABOUT GLADSTONE Gladstone is the leading supplier of leisure management software across the UK and Ireland.
raw.description:
Job Description:

Head of Data & AI

ABOUT GLADSTONE

Gladstone is the leading supplier of leisure management software across the UK and Ireland. We empower customers in the health, fitness, and leisure sectors to grow participation, strengthen engagement, and improve operational performance through our cloud-based platforms.

As part of Jonas Software and Constellation Software Inc., we combine global stability with local agility. Our transformation programme - Project NOVA - is redefining how we bring innovation to market, deepen customer partnerships, and deliver elevated sector experiences.

THE ROLE

The Head of Data & AI is a senior technical leadership role responsible for shaping and delivering Gladstone’s data and AI capabilities. Reporting directly to the CTO, this role combines hands-on technical leadership with collaboration across product, engineering, and commercial teams to build a secure, scalable data and AI platform. You will lead a small team of data and analytics engineers, while helping embed machine learning, AI agents, and advanced analytics into real customer workflows — ensuring data and AI are applied thoughtfully, responsibly, and with clear business impact.

KEY MISSIONS:

Own the Data & AI Platform — Design and evolve a modern, scalable data platform centred on Snowflake to power analytics, AI models, and agent-based workflows.

Enable AI-First Products — Build and operationalise machine learning models, embeddings, and vector stores that support AI agents and intelligent customer experiences.

Lead a High-Impact Team — Develop and mentor a small team of data and analytics engineers, setting technical direction and delivery standards.

Bridge Strategy and Execution — Translate business and product goals into robust data and AI solutions that deliver measurable value.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Own the design and evolution of Gladstone’s data and AI platform, with Snowflake as the core analytical and ML data store.

  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines, models, and data products to support analytics, AI, and multi-tenant use cases.

  • Design, train, and deploy machine learning models, embeddings, and vector stores to enable AI agents and intelligent workflows.

  • Lead and mentor a small team of data and analytics engineers, setting technical standards and delivery priorities.

  • Partner with Product, R&D, and Infrastructure to embed data and AI capabilities into customer-facing platforms.

  • Ensure data quality, security, governance, and performance across the data and AI estate.

  • Provide clear technical insight, progress updates, and recommendations directly to the CTO.

LEADERSHIP COMPETENCIES:

Technical Authority — Deep expertise with the credibility to lead architectural and modelling decisions.

Hands-On Leadership — Comfortable building while leading others.

Strategic Thinking — Able to connect data and AI capabilities to product and business outcomes.

Execution Excellence — Delivers reliable, production-grade solutions.

Collaboration & Influence — Works effectively across technical and non-technical teams.

SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:

Essential

  • Expert-level Snowflake knowledge, including data modelling, performance optimisation, and advanced features.

  • Strong Python skills for data engineering, ML, and AI development.

  • Proven experience building and deploying machine learning models.

  • Hands-on experience with embeddings, vector databases, and AI/LLM-driven systems.

  • Strong understanding of modern data engineering practices (ELT, orchestration, versioning).

Desirable

  • Background in data science or applied machine learning.

  • Experience enabling AI agents or intelligent automation.

  • Familiarity with cloud-native architectures and MLOps practices.

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

  • 5+ years’ experience in data engineering, data science, or ML-focused roles.

  • Demonstrated leadership of data or analytics engineering teams.

  • Proven track record delivering production-grade data and AI platforms.

  • Experience working closely with senior technical leadership (CTO, Head of Engineering, etc.).

We recognise that great candidates may not meet every requirement and encourage applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

Business Unit:

Gladstone Software

Scheduled Weekly Hours:

37.5

Number of Openings Available:

1

Worker Type:

Regular

Company Site:

http://www.gladstonesoftware.co.uk

More About Jonas Software:

Jonas Software is a leading provider of enterprise management software solutions, serving a wide range of vertical markets including hospitality, healthcare, construction, education, personal care, fitness, leisure, moving and legal services, to name a few. Within these markets, Jonas is comprised of over 65 distinct brands, each a respected leader in its domain.

Jonas’ vision is to be the branded global leader across these verticals and to be recognized by customers and industry stakeholders as the trusted provider of “Software for Life.” We are committed to technology, product innovation, quality, and exceptional customer service.

Jonas Software supports over 60,000 customers in more than 30 countries. We employ over 6,000 skilled professionals, including industry experts and technology specialists. Across our broader network, we support a global workforce of more than 30,000 employees.

Headquartered in Canada, Jonas Software has a global footprint with offices around the world. We’re a 100% owned subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc., based in Toronto, publicly listed on the TSX (CSU.TO), and a member of the S&P/TSX 60 Index.

Is This You ?

title: FTZ Consultant
description: QAD, Inc.  has an immediate opening for a knowledgeable individual to assist QAD in implementing its Foreign-Trade Zone (FTZ) software.

raw.title: FTZ Consultant
raw.excerpt: QAD, Inc.  has an immediate opening for a knowledgeable individual to assist QAD in implementing its Foreign-Trade Zone (FTZ) software.
raw.description:
QAD, Inc. has an immediate opening for a knowledgeable individual to assist QAD in implementing its Foreign-Trade Zone (FTZ) software. This individual will provide professional services to our customers for the implementation of our FTZ software in large manufacturing and distribution companies across a wide variety of industries.

What you will be doing:

You will be working directly with our customer's compliance and technical teams to map data from the customers systems into QAD FTZ, validate and test data feeds, and work with the customers to develop process flows and procedures for their unique FTZ processing needs. You will work closely with the customer's FTZ consultant, as well as QAD's team of project managers, and technical engineers to assist and support you during the implementation process.

Where You Will Be Working: This is a remote position based in the US.

  • 2+ years of experience implementing or operating FTZs
  • First-hand understanding of foreign-trade zone operations, and related processes
  • Ability to work on multiple projects at once and deliver on-time results
  • Have a working knowledge of logistics activities including import activities
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • The individual should be self motivated and be capable of working as part of a team, or alone, with little supervision.
  • In-Depth experience using spreadsheets and Microsoft Word or Google Docs
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Excel
  • Understanding of XML file structure and ability to validate data format
  • Understanding of flat-files and ability to validate data format
  • Understanding of electronic communication methods
  • Familiarity with Microsoft SQL Server is a plus
  • Understanding of programming languages and methodologies is a plus

Desired Experience:

  • Experience implementing FTZ systems
  • Experience operating FTZ systems
  • Experience with Import and Export systems, compliance systems, Global Trade Management (GTM)
  • Experience implementing ERP or WMS systems
  • Experience creating and executing test cases and test scripts
  • Experience implementing, data-mapping, integrating is a plus
  • Your health and well being are important to us at QAD. We provide programs that help you strike a healthy work-life balance.
  • Opportunity to join a growing business, launching into its next phase of expansion and transformation.
  • Collaborative culture of smart and hard-working people who support one another to get the job done.
  • An atmosphere of growth and opportunity, where idea-sharing is always prioritized over level or hierarchy.

Compensation Package:

  • Base pay range: $80,000.00 - $90,000.00 USD Annual (12 Months)
  • Placement within our pay range will vary based on knowledge, skills, experience, and market location variations as well as internal peer equity
  • This position is also eligible for an annual company performance bonus
  • U.S. benefits package includes medical, dental and vision coverage, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, paid-time off, parental leave, and well-being programs

About QAD:

QAD | Redzone is redefining manufacturing and supply chains through its intelligent, adaptive platform that connects people, processes, and data into a single System of Action. With three core pillars — Redzone (frontline empowerment), Adaptive Applications (the intelligent backbone), and Champion AI (Agentic AI for manufacturing) — QAD | Redzone helps manufacturers operate with Champion Pace, achieving measurable productivity, resilience, and growth in just 90 days.

QAD is committed to ensuring that every employee feels they work in an environment that values their contributions, respects their unique perspectives and provides opportunities for growth regardless of background. QAD’s DEI program is driving higher levels of diversity, equity and inclusion so that employees can bring their whole self to work.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

QAD is building a world-class SaaS company, and we are growing. We are looking for talented individuals who want to join us on our mission to help solve relevant real-world problems in manufacturing and the supply chain.

We are a virtual first company and your primary work experience will be virtual / working from your home. Occasional travel to a physical office may be required to enhance working relationships, collaboration, design, strategy and alignment.

title: Business Development Representative/Représentant en développement des affaires
description: This is a 100% remote role in Canada!  Who we are looking forAs a Business Development Representative at GlobalVision, you will be contributing to the growth of our organization’s sales by positioning the value of GlobalVision's products to new prospects and current clients via cold calls and emails.

raw.title: Business Development Representative/Représentant en développement des affaires
raw.excerpt: This is a 100% remote role in Canada!  Who we are looking forAs a Business Development Representative at GlobalVision, you will be contributing to the growth of our organization’s sales by positioning the value of GlobalVision's products to new prospects and current clients via cold calls and emails.
raw.description:
This is a 100% remote role in Canada!

Who we are looking for

As a Business Development Representative at GlobalVision, you will be contributing to the growth of our organization’s sales by positioning the value of GlobalVision's products to new prospects and current clients via cold calls and emails. You will also participate in social selling and networking. You will closely work with sales, marketing, and lead generation specialists.

The Day-to-Day

  • Identify prospects that match our ideal customer profile and contact these leads via cold calls and emails.
  • Effectively present our offerings, identify client needs and suggest appropriate solutions.
  • Dissect and qualify prospects’ business goals to determine if GlobalVision can be a strategic investment for their business growth.
  • Set qualified meetings for the Account Executive team.
  • Qualify marketing-generated leads: inbound, campaigns and events.
  • Build long-term relationships with potential and existing clients.
  • Bring your thinking, strategies, and ideas to advance our company’s values, unique culture, and vision for the future.

Indicators that you could be a good match for this role

  • You have 1-2 years of proven BDR/SDR experience in a B2B SaaS environment, preferably with experience targeting mid-market or enterprise accounts.
  • You have a demonstrated ability to meet and exceed monthly/quarterly quotas.
  • Experience prospecting, cold calling and cold emailing.
  • Fluent in English.
  • You have a hunter’s mentality - resilient and persistent.
  • You have experience using Google Suite (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Sheets, Meet & Drive).
  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent.
  • Strong time management and organizational skills.
  • You resonate with our values.
  • You are comfortable stepping out of the responsibilities in this job description!
  • You're able to work autonomously and stay self-motivated.
  • You have strong written communication skills (this is key to succeeding in an asynchronous workplace like ours).

Nice to haves

  • Experience with tools such as Salesforce, ZoomInfo, Outreach and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.
  • Able to easily foster connections with people.
  • You are deeply curious, crave feedback, and are excited about learning in an accelerated environment.

Quebec candidates must be fluent in English and French. As an international company with clients, employees, and contractors located around the world, English is required to work with GlobalVision’s internal and external stakeholders.

Who we are

At GlobalVision, we build technology that empowers regulated industries to launch their digital and printed assets faster—without sacrificing quality. For 35 years, we've successfully balanced agility with innovation, while remaining profitable and independent.

As a remote-first organization, you have the flexibility to work from wherever you thrive, allowing you to create your ideal work environment. You’ll also have the freedom to self-manage your paid time off and set your own work schedule, promoting a healthy work-life balance. We don’t track hours, we track results! Plus, when the company grows, so do you - part of our profits are shared with full-time employees, ensuring that your success is directly tied to ours.

We live by these values, and we hope you do too:

  • Freedom to innovate: Experiment, take risks, and learn from failure—it’s how we stay ahead.
  • Grow, sustainably: We play the long game, prioritizing smart, lasting success over quick wins.
  • Problems are opportunities: Challenges push us to do our best work and evolve for the better.
  • Trust & autonomy: You have the space, resources, and support to own your work and make an impact.
  • Radiate passion & positivity: We bring energy, teamwork, and a can-do attitude to everything we do.
  • Continuous feedback: Learning never stops—feedback fuels our growth, both as individuals and as a team.

Why you should join us

  • Make a real impact. We solve mission-critical problems for Fortune 500 companies—your work matters.
  • No red tape. You’re encouraged to lead, take initiative, and think outside the box.
  • A diverse team. Work alongside brilliant minds from different backgrounds and perspectives.
  • Best Workplace in Canada 2025!

Want to learn more?

  • Our website
  • Careers page

Ready to be part of something bold? Let’s build the future together.

Il s'agit d'un poste 100 % à distance au Canada !

Qui recherchons-nous ?

En tant que représentant du développement des affaires chez GlobalVision, vous contribuerez à la croissance des ventes de notre organisation en positionnant la valeur des produits de GlobalVision auprès de nouveaux prospects et de clients actuels par le biais d'appels à froid et de courriels. Vous participerez également à la vente sociale et au réseautage. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les spécialistes des ventes, du marketing et de la génération de leads.

Le quotidien

  • Identifier les prospects qui correspondent à notre profil de client idéal et les contacter par le biais d'appels à froid et d'e-mails.
  • Présenter efficacement nos offres, identifier les besoins des clients et proposer des solutions appropriées.
  • Disséquer et qualifier les objectifs commerciaux des prospects afin de déterminer si GlobalVision peut être un investissement stratégique pour la croissance de leur entreprise.
  • Organiser des réunions qualifiées pour l'équipe de chargés de clientèle.
  • Qualifier les prospects générés par le marketing : appels entrants, campagnes et événements.
  • Construire des relations à long terme avec les clients potentiels et existants.
  • Apportez votre réflexion, vos stratégies et vos idées pour faire progresser les valeurs de notre entreprise, sa culture unique et sa vision de l'avenir.

Indicateurs montrant que vous pourriez être un bon candidat pour ce poste

  • Vous avez 1 à 2 ans d'expérience avérée en tant que BDR/SDR dans un environnement SaaS B2B, de préférence avec une expérience dans le ciblage de comptes de taille moyenne ou d'entreprise.
  • Vous avez démontré votre capacité à atteindre et à dépasser les quotas mensuels/trimestriels.
  • Vous avez de l'expérience dans la prospection, les appels à froid et les e-mails à froid.
  • Vous parlez couramment l'anglais.
  • Vous avez une mentalité de chasseur : vous êtes résilient et persévérant.
  • Vous avez de l'expérience dans l'utilisation de Google Suite (Gmail, Calendar, Docs, Sheets, Meet & Drive).
  • Au minimum un diplôme de licence ou équivalent.
  • Solides compétences en gestion du temps et en organisation.
  • Vous adhérez à nos valeurs.
  • Vous êtes à l'aise pour sortir du cadre des responsabilités décrites dans cette offre d'emploi !
  • Vous êtes capable de travailler de manière autonome et de rester motivé.
  • Vous avez de solides compétences en communication écrite (ce qui est essentiel pour réussir dans un environnement de travail asynchrone comme le nôtre).

Atouts supplémentaires

  • Expérience avec des outils tels que Salesforce, ZoomInfo, Outreach et LinkedIn Sales Navigator.
  • Capacité à nouer facilement des relations avec les gens.
  • Vous êtes très curieux, avide de commentaires et enthousiaste à l'idée d'apprendre dans un environnement dynamique.

Les candidats du Québec doivent parler couramment l'anglais et le français. En tant qu'entreprise internationale ayant des clients, des employés et des sous-traitants dans le monde entier, l'anglais est nécessaire pour travailler avec les parties prenantes internes et externes de GlobalVision.

Qui sommes-nous ?

Chez GlobalVision, nous concevons des technologies qui permettent aux industries réglementées de lancer plus rapidement leurs actifs numériques et imprimés, sans sacrifier la qualité. Depuis 35 ans, nous avons réussi à concilier agilité et innovation, tout en restant rentables et indépendants.

En tant qu'entreprise à distance, vous avez la possibilité de travailler depuis l'endroit où vous vous épanouissez, ce qui vous permet de créer votre environnement de travail idéal. Vous aurez également la liberté de gérer vous-même vos congés payés et de fixer votre propre horaire de travail, ce qui favorisera un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée. Nous ne comptabilisons pas les heures, nous comptabilisons les résultats ! De plus, lorsque l'entreprise se développe, vous faites de même - une partie de nos bénéfices est partagée avec les employés à temps plein, ce qui garantit que votre réussite est directement liée à la nôtre.

Nous croyons fermement en ces valeurs, alors assurez-vous que vous y croyez aussi :

  • La liberté d'innover : Expérimenter, prendre des risques et apprendre de l'échec - c'est ainsi que nous restons en tête.
  • Croître, de manière soutenable : Nous jouons sur le long terme, en donnant la priorité aux succès intelligents et durables plutôt qu'aux gains rapides.
  • Les problèmes sont des opportunités : Les défis nous poussent à donner le meilleur de nous-mêmes et à évoluer pour le meilleur.
  • Confiance et autonomie : Vous disposez de l'espace, des ressources et du soutien nécessaires pour vous approprier votre travail et avoir un impact.
  • Rayonner de passion et de positivité : Nous apportons de l'énergie, un travail d'équipe et une attitude positive dans tout ce que nous faisons.
  • Rétroaction continuelle : L'apprentissage ne s'arrête jamais - le retour d'information alimente notre croissance, à la fois en tant qu'individus et en tant qu'équipe.

Pourquoi vous devriez nous joindre

  • Ayez un impact réel. Nous résolvons des problèmes critiques pour des entreprises Fortune 500 - votre travail est important.
  • Pas de paperasserie. Vous êtes encouragé à diriger, à prendre des initiatives et à sortir des sentiers battus.
  • Une équipe diversifiée. Travaillez aux côtés d'esprits brillants issus de milieux et de perspectives différents.
  • Meilleur lieu de travail au Canada 2025 !

Vous voulez en savoir plus ?

  • Notre site web
  • Page des carrières

Prêt à participer à un projet audacieux ? Construisons l'avenir ensemble.

title: Senior AI Engineer
description: At CDW, we make it happen, together.  Trust, connection, and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers.

raw.title: Senior AI Engineer
raw.excerpt: At CDW, we make it happen, together.  Trust, connection, and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers.
raw.description:
At CDW, we make it happen, together. Trust, connection, and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers. It’s why we’re coworkers, not just employees. Coworkers who genuinely believe in supporting our customers and one another. We collectively forge our path forward with a level of commitment that speaks to who we are and where we’re headed. We’re proud to share our story and Make Amazing Happen at CDW.

At CDW, we make it happen, together. Trust, connection, and commitment are at the heart of how we work together to deliver for our customers. It’s why we’re coworkers, not just employees. Coworkers who genuinely believe in supporting our customers and one another. We collectively forge our path forward with a level of commitment that speaks to who we are and where we’re headed. We’re proud to share our story and Make Amazing Happen at CDW.

Job summary

We are seeking a Senior AI Engineer to transition our AI capabilities from "prototype" to "production." In this role, you will not just experiment with models; you will architect robust Agentic Systems that can plan, reason, and execute complex workflows autonomously for a wide variety of business user needs while experimenting with cutting-edge models and tools to push the boundaries of what’s possible.

The ideal candidate is a forward-thinking engineer who thrives on hands-on experimentation with AI models and frameworks, learns quickly, and is naturally curious. You will collaborate closely with product managers, business partners, and platform teams to deliver high-value AI agents that solve real-world problems across the enterprise

What you will do:

  • Agentic Engineering & Orchestration
    • Workflow Design: Architect complex, multi-agent workflows using Microsoft AI tech stack. Design, Develop and Deploy agents to handle loops, interruptions, and human-in-the-loop interventions.
    • Tool Use & Function Calling: Build reliable "tool layers" that allow LLMs to safely interact with internal APIs, databases, and third-party SaaS platforms (e.g., SalesForce, Workday, ServiceNow etc.)
    • State Management: Design persistence layers to manage agent memory, conversational history, and context windows efficiently.
  • Advanced Data & RAG Strategy
    • Retrieval Pipelines: Build production-grade data retrieval and integration systems. Optimize vector indexing, document chunking, and re-ranking algorithms to ensure high-precision context retrieval.
    • Data Quality: Collaborate with Data Engineers to curate "Golden Datasets" for agent consumption
  • LLMOps, Evaluation & Quality
    • Automated Evaluation: Build CI/CD pipelines for AI that include "LLM-as-a-Judge" testing. Leverage frameworks to score agent outputs for accuracy, hallucination, and safety before deployment.
    • Observability: Instrument applications with tracing tools to visualize agent reasoning chains, monitor latency, and debug failures in production.
    • Cost Optimization: Monitor token usage and latency, optimizing prompt density and caching strategies to maintain high performance at sustainable costs.
  • Innovation & Collaboration
    • Prototyping to Production: Rapidly validate new ideas using state-of-the-art models, then refactor successful prototypes into maintainable, tested production code.
    • Standards Adoption: Stay ahead of the curve by evaluating emerging technologies to standardize agent connectivity.

What we expect of you

  • Core Engineering: Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of software engineering experience, with exposure to AI/ML applications OR 9 years of software engineering experience, with exposure to AI/ML applications
  • AI Specialization: 2+ years specifically building with LLMs, with deep familiarity in:
    • Orchestration: LangChain, LangGraph, or similar state-based frameworks.
    • Vector DBs: Pinecone, Weaviate, or pgvector.
    • Prompt Engineering: Advanced techniques (Chain-of-Thought, ReAct, Few-Shot).
  • Production Mindset: Experience not just building demos, but operating them. You know how to handle rate limits, context window overflows, and non-deterministic errors.
  • Soft Skills: Ability to explain "probabilistic software" to non-technical stakeholders—managing expectations that agents are never 100% accurate, but can be 100% useful.
  • Excellent communication skills, with experience in documenting technical designs, sharing insights, and enabling team knowledge transfer.

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to design and build the next generation of enterprise AI agents.
  • A collaborative environment where experimentation and innovation are encouraged.

We make technology work so people can do great things.

CDW is a leading multi-brand provider of information technology solutions to business, government, education and healthcare customers in the United States, the United Kingdom and Canada. A Fortune 500 company and member of the S&P 500 Index, CDW helps its customers to navigate an increasingly complex IT market and maximize return on their technology investments. Together, we unite. Together, we win. Together, we thrive.

Pay range: $124,000 - $ 174,600 depending on experience and skill set
Benefits overview: https://cdw.benefit-info.com/
Salary ranges may be subject to geographic differentials

We make technology work so people can do great things.    

CDW is a leading multi-brand provider of information technology solutions to business, government, education and healthcare customers in the United States, the United Kingdom and Canada. A Fortune 500 company and member of the S&P 500 Index, CDW helps its customers to navigate an increasingly complex IT market and maximize return on their technology investments. Together, we unite. Together, we win. Together, we thrive.

CDW is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by state and local law.     

CDW is committed to fostering an equitable, transparent, and respectful hiring process for all applicants. During our application process, CDW’s goal is to get to know you as an applicant and understand your experience, strengths, skills, and qualifications. While AI can help you present yourself more clearly and effectively, the essence of your application should be authentically yours. To learn more, please review CDW's AI Applicant Notice.

title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
description: At Simply. TV you can work on everything from building frameworks for data ingest and processing, to data enrichment tools, migration tools, and the delivery of normalized datasets in JSON, XML and CSV via APIs, FTP, S3 buckets and more.

raw.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
raw.excerpt: At Simply. TV you can work on everything from building frameworks for data ingest and processing, to data enrichment tools, migration tools, and the delivery of normalized datasets in JSON, XML and CSV via APIs, FTP, S3 buckets and more.
raw.description:
At Simply.TV you can work on everything from building frameworks for data ingest and processing, to data enrichment tools, migration tools, and the delivery of normalized datasets in JSON, XML and CSV via APIs, FTP, S3 buckets and more.

We have hundreds of editors working directly in our own tech stack, pushing through thousands of datasets every day. You can choose to focus on building tools used by more than 200 editors across Europe and North America, or lean more into DevOps, utilizing AWS services such as ECS, EC2, RDS, Lambda functions and others.

You will have a say in defining your role at Simply.TV and where you feel you best contribute to a fast‑growing scale‑up in the entertainment industry. In this role, you will collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to support their needs in both tooling and data processing: translating user input into software solutions, and deploying and maintaining existing services.

We are a small organization. We don’t have layers of product managers or scrum masters chasing you for delivery. Instead, you’ll work directly with the end users of your solutions and see the impact of your work first‑hand.

If you enjoy being creative, you will also have the opportunity to design new workflows, dataflows, or even entirely new tools. We listen to our colleagues and empower them to build great solutions.

Our primary stack is Ruby on Rails version 7, with the intention to upgrade all our apps to Rails 8 in the coming months. We work with Docker, AWS ECS, MySQL and Elasticsearch. You will sometimes work solo on projects and at other times in small teams of 2–3 engineers on larger initiatives that span multiple Rails applications, supported by our Product Owner.

We pride ourselves on high employee retention. We build strong teams that enjoy working and growing together.

We’re small, flat, and retention-focused—building teams that love growing together.

Responsibilities

You are successful when:

  • You design and build frameworks for data ingest, processing, enrichment and migration.
  • You deliver normalized datasets (JSON, XML, CSV) via APIs, FTP, S3 buckets and similar channels.
  • You develop and maintain internal tools used daily by hundreds of editors across multiple regions.
  • You collaborate with internal stakeholders to understand their needs and translate them into robust software solutions.
  • You deploy, monitor and maintain existing services within our Ruby on Rails and AWS‑based stack.
  • You work directly with end users to gather feedback and continuously improve tools and workflows.
  • You identify and engineer new workflows, dataflows and tools where they create value for the business.
  • You contribute both as an independent engineer and as part of small project teams (2–3 engineers) on cross‑application initiatives.

Requirements

Qualifications

You’ll thrive in this role if you:

  • Bring 5+ years of professional experience as a software engineer with Ruby on Rails.
  • Are comfortable working with cloud-based infrastructures, CI/CD pipelines, and modern development workflows.
  • Have a strong delivery mindset and enjoy seeing your work used by real customers.
  • Possess strong troubleshooting skills and a pragmatic approach to problem solving.
  • Communicate clearly in written and spoken English and collaborate effectively across teams.
  • Enjoy problem-solving, taking ownership, and working in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

Bonus

  • Experience with Docker.
  • Experience with Elasticsearch.
  • HTML and CSS (Bootstrap and Tailwind).
  • JavaScript (Stimulus + native JS); new projects are started with Stimulus.

Personal traits

  • Curious and eager to learn.
  • Not shy about doing R&D and exploring new approaches.
  • Comfortable working with changing priorities and a broad range of responsibilities.
  • Happy to work independently and from home, while staying closely connected to a distributed team.

Why join?

  • 🚀 Work at the forefront of media tech – Help shape how millions discover TV & streaming content.
  • 🤝 Be a trusted counterpart – Work directly with key clients to drive their technical success and satisfaction.
  • 🌍 Collaborate globally – Join a strong team across continents that thrives on innovation and teamwork.
  • 🎯 Make real impact – Your contribution ensures Simply.TV’s data and solutions empower millions of end users daily.
  • 📈 Grow and learn continuously – Gain exposure to advanced technologies, media systems, and client infrastructures.

Benefits

Practicalities

Reports to: Lead Engineer

Location: Europe (CET remote)

Type of Collaboration: collaboration based on a freelancer set-up on a full-time allocation basis (40 hours per week).

raw.description:
Job (Project) Description:

We are seeking an experienced SAP Business Analyst / SAP Data Analyst to lead data and process activities for SAP projects, ensuring alignment with group standards and integration of satellite systems across manufacturing and retail operations.

As an SAP Business/Data Analyst, you will act as a key liaison between business and IT, ensuring business requirements are accurately captured and mapped to SAP master data, supporting UAT, and training key business users.

Locations:

Turkey

Requirements:

Education & Certification:

  • Bachelors degree in information technology, Business Administration, or related field.
  • Masters degree is a plus.

Experience:

  • Hands-on experience as SAP Business Analyst or SAP Data Analyst.
  • Minimum 5–7 years of functional experience working with different types of data using SQL and ETL tools.
  • Hands-on involvement in at least one large-scale ERP implementation, ideally as a data expert.
  • Good understanding of SAP master data, business requirements, and SAP functional capabilities.

Skills:

  • Deep knowledge of SAP and ERP systems.
  • Good understanding of SAP master data, business requirements and SAP functional capabilities
  • Data analysis, modeling, integration, and migration expertise.
  • Understanding of business processes across different functional areas.
  • Ability to map business requirements and identify improvements.
  • Experience supporting UAT and training of key business users.
  • Strong problem-solving, communication, and documentation skills.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Conduct workshops and interviews to map current processes and requirements.
  • Ensure accurate transfer of data from legacy systems to SAP.
  • Support training programs for key business users.
  • Oversee testing phases, including UAT, to ensure SAP system performs as expected.
  • Optimize SAP processes and master data management over time.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary.
  • 100% remote opportunity.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.
  • A collaborative and innovative work environment.
